content:
SUMMER BRINGS examinations, both for students and for America’s banks. Each year since 2011, the Federal Reserve has set “stress tests” for the banks. They must show how much capital they have, the quality of that capital and what activities they are up to. The Fed uses this evidence to determine whether an adverse shock—economic, financial or otherwise—might put too large a dent in that capital. The tests are one feature of the post-crisis Dodd-Frank financial-reform act, and they aim to ensure that lenders have enough equity on hand should catastrophe strike again. Failure to measure up can result in the Fed curtailing a bank’s ability to distribute cash to shareholders, in the form of dividends or share buybacks.

On June 21st the Fed announced that America’s banks passed this year’s tests with flying colours. That paves the way for bumper payouts to shareholders. The four largest retail banks, JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America, Wells Fargo and Citigroup, plus the two biggest investment banks, Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley, purchased $93.1bn-worth of their own stock in 2018. That will rise to $117.9bn in 2019. Most banks have also raised their planned distribution of dividends by more than 10%. On June 27th the Fed approved these capital plans for America’s 18 largest banks (though their approval for Credit Suisse is conditional on the bank addressing what the regulator regarded as weaknesses in its plans for share repurchases and dividends).

In one way, the stress tests were tougher than ever before. The worst hypothetical shock this year included a global recession in which American unemployment rises to 10%, accompanied by sliding property prices and stressed corporate-debt markets. Even under this scenario banks would hold more capital than the Fed’s minimum requirement (although only just in the cases of JPMorgan Chase and Capital One). Randal Quarles, who oversees bank regulation at the Fed, said that “the results confirm that our financial system remains resilient”.

But there are fears that the Fed made the tests easier in other ways. A smaller cohort of banks—just the very biggest—was tested this year, following a roll-back of Dodd-Frank passed by Congress in 2018 which meant smaller banks need not be tested every year. And banks were also given more information about how the test would be conducted. In previous years they had received details only about the catastrophic scenarios, not about the models the Fed would use to test them. Banks had complained that this made their task akin to trying to hit a moving target in the dark.

Daniel Tarullo, a former Fed governor who stepped down in 2017 and who designed the Fed’s stress tests, had been wary of divulging more information. He feared banks would rearrange their balance-sheets merely to meet the test, and argued that publishing the Fed’s models would “result in less protection for the financial system”. Mr Quarles has a different opinion. He has said the change is akin to “giving banks the textbook—not the test”. The Fed published “enhanced descriptions” of the models it uses in March.

Next year the tests may be changed more radically yet. On July 9th the Fed is hosting a conference in Boston to review the stress-testing procedures. Many in the industry suspect that it will say it intends to adopt a new test, the “stress capital buffer”, alongside stress tests. Currently, passing the stress test requires that a bank’s common-equity “Tier 1” capital ratio—a measure of its equity—does not dip below 4.5% in the worst scenario the Fed examines. Proving this requires banks to outline their planned dividend repurchases and share buybacks a year in advance.

A stress capital buffer would use the results of the stress test to designate a minimum common-equity Tier 1 ratio for rest of the year. The buffer would be calculated as the difference between a firm’s common-equity Tier 1 ratio at present—and what it would hypothetically fall to under the worst scenario tested. Goldman Sachs’s common-equity Tier 1 capital ratio is 13.3% at present, for example, but would be just 6.7% under the worst scenario. Its stress capital buffer would be 6.6%, the difference between the two. The total common-equity Tier 1 capital ratio the bank would need to maintain year-round would therefore be the minimum (4.5%), plus its stress capital buffer and a surcharge for being big and systemically important.

Banks with stable businesses are largely in favour of the change, as it would allow them to vary their dividends and buybacks through the year—as most companies do—rather than outlining plans in advance. But the new procedure would most affect banks that undertake risky, volatile activities, which might see their capital requirements vary wildly with the economic cycle. Although most would end up having to hold roughly the same amount of capital as now, those with large trading business, such as Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley, might have to raise more capital in the future. The goal might be a wise one, however. Passing one stress test is well and good, but what the Fed really wants is for them to be passed with flying colours year after year.

eg2: Both "sausage" and "meatball" pigment Sacs appear in a sample from the cheek feathers of Anchiornis.
近鸟龙的头部羽毛样本同时出现了“香肠”和“肉球”状的色素囊。
More sounds meant more information could be shared, giving those who lacked air  a better chance of survival in a dangerous world.
声音增多意味着可以分享的信息增多，这使得那些没有气囊的祖先在危险环境里的生存几率大大增加。
COPD inflames the bronchial tubes and the tiny Sacs called alveoli that line the lungs, making them less flexible and elastic.
COPD能使支气管和排满肺部的叫做气泡的小型气囊发炎，从而使他们失去弹性和柔软性。

ex: n. 斯坦利（男子名）

eg2: Additionally,  will support the development of forensic applications and capabilities for all stages of the forensic process.
此外，斯坦利将为法庭应用的发展和对法庭程序的所有阶段的能力提供支持。
Since the middle of 2007, Morgan Stanley has raised about twenty billion dollars in new capital and cut in half its leverage ratio—the total value of its assets divided by its capital.
自2007年中期以来，摩根-斯坦利已经筹集了大约200亿美元的新资本，并且把它的杠杆比率削减了一半——它的资产总额通过资本进行划分。
When Stanley Cavell poses the question in the title of one of his books Must We Mean What We Say?
当斯坦利卡维尔的著作,《我们一定得心口相一么》的书名提出了这个问题时？

ex: adj. 不利的；相反的；敌对的（名词adverseness，副词adversely）

wp.adverse exchange: 逆汇;		逆汇兑;逆汇方式
wp.adverse event: 不良事件;不利事件;副作用;不良反应
wp.adverse balance: 收支逆差;贸易逆差;赤字;贸易差额
wp.adverse effects: 负面影响;不良反应;副作用;不利影响
wp.adverse condition: 不利条件;		有害状态;不利状况

eg2: My sister's taste in dresses is adverse to my own.
我妹妹的服饰审美观完全与我相反。
But the only requirement is that they notify the project if they suffer any adverse effects from their participation.
唯一的要求是，当他们因参与此工程而受到任何不利影响时，一定要通知项目研究人员。
Currently, discrimination because of sex is defined as adverse action against another person, which would not have occurred had the person been of another sex.
如今，性别歧视被定义为做出对另一性别的人的反对行为，如果那个人是相反的性别就不会发生这种歧视了。

wp.akin to: 有亲密关系的;类似于;同类;近似

ex: adj. 类似的；同类的；同族的
n. (Akin)人名；(土、瑞典、尼日利)阿金；(匈)奥金；(英)埃金
eg2: Goodall wondered, "Is it not possible that these (chimpanzee) performances are stimulated by feelings  to wonder and awe?
古多尔在想：这是不可能的，这些黑猩猩表演是由类似的感受惊奇和敬畏刺激？
He felt an indescribable sensation somewhat  to dread--that dread of the daylight which even in the desert makes us fear we are watched and observed.
他有一种说不出感觉，有点近乎恐怖，那是一种在光天化日之下，即使在沙漠里我们也怕被人看到的恐怖。
Several people took a gesture of political confrontation on the street  to "perfor-mance art," but this remains a mere episode, as long as we do not set a "zero tolerance" goal.
一些人走上街头，采取政治对抗的姿态，这无异于一种“行为艺术”，但只要我们对这样的事件不做“零容忍”，其只会是社会生活中的一个小插曲。

他们对这项计划表示赞成。
The students chorused their  of the suggestion.
同学们对该建议齐声表示赞成。
She evidenced her approval by promising her full support。
她答应全力支持，以此来表明她的赞成。

ex: vt. 批准；赞成；为…提供证据

我觉得他赞成那个计划.
Would she ?
她会赞成吗？
Whether you approve or not, this has been an era of bold movement.
不论你赞成与否，这些都说明了这是一个着敢作敢为的时代。

wp.data buffer: 数据缓冲器;数据缓冲区;数据缓存;数据缓冲

wp.hydraulic buffer: 油压缓冲器;		液压缓冲器;耗能型缓冲器;液压缓冲

eg2: This is why our next four columns will deal with buffer overflow.
这就是下面四个专栏将讨论缓冲区溢位的原因。
This improves performance for these LOBs because you can access them through the buffer pool.
这提高了这些 LOB 的性能，因为可以通过缓冲区池对其进行访问。
By raising the value of LOGBUFSZ to 64 (256K) or more, the log  will not fill, and there will only be one log write (at commit) for the bulk insert.
如果将 LOGBUFSZ 的值增加到 64 页（256K）或者更大，缓冲池就不会被填满，这样的话对于该批量插入就只有一次日志写（在提交时）。

eg2: Or put it on your busines card, billboard or a  sticker.
或者把它放在你的名片、布告板、或者缓冲器中。
Prices of grain and cotton ruled low owing to a  harvest this year.
由于今年的丰收，粮棉价格普遍偏低。
I'm pretty sure the bumper sticker that reads, "The joy of the journey is not in reaching the destination but in the ride, " is one of those simple truths and is most assuredly an ancient wisdom.
我在一张保险杠贴纸上看到过这样一句话：“旅行的乐趣不在于到达目的地而在旅行的过程中。” 我确信这是一个简单的真理，也是一种最具说服力的古老智慧。

ex: n. 回购，回买协议

ex: n. 大灾难；大祸；惨败
eg2: He is teetering on the edge of .
他在大灾难的边缘徘徊。
Finally, we hope against hope that we have the courage to ensure that this type of catastrophe can be prevented or mitigated.
最后，我们还是抱有一线希望，希望我们有勇气保证能够预防或者减轻这样的大灾难。
A catastrophe is brewing.
一场灾祸正在酿成。

wp.catastrophic forgetting: 灾难性忘却;灾难性遗忘

ex: adj. 灾难的；悲惨的；灾难性的，毁灭性的
eg2: As an author, libraries are the place you go to meet your readers, the centre of their community, and to lose this service would be .
作为一名作家，图书馆是你能和读者见面的地方，他们的社区的中心，失去 图书馆的后果将是灾难性的。

ex: vt. 缩减；剪短；剥夺…特权等
eg2: For parents, this means now is the time to  the cycle of debt and create a savings plan for your child’s future.
对于家长来说，这意味着现在我们到了缩减债务周期并为子女的将来开启一个储蓄理财计划的时候了。
If you are expecting both people to grow in the same direction and in the same way, that is unfair to both people. It will curtail and suffocate both of their lives.
如果你期望两个人都能朝着同一个方向用同样的方式成长，这对两个人都是不公平的，这也会压抑和剥夺彼此的生活乐趣。

wp.Viceroy Designate: 任命而尚未赴任的总督

ex: vt. 指定；指派；标出；把…定名为
adj. 指定的；选定的
eg2: You could designate one of your internal machines as the time server.
您可以指定一台内部的机器作为时间服务器。
For each set, you must designate one primary persona; the others are all secondary.
对每个组，您必须指派一个主要角色，其他的都是次要的。
To make sure your family or other heirs get this money, you should designate them by name as the beneficiaries.
为了确保你的家庭和其他继承人得到了这笔财产，你应该以姓名的方式把他们指定成受益人。

ex: n. 游一游；泡一泡；（通常指暂时的）减少；凹陷处
v. 蘸；浸；（使）下降；把（汽车前灯的）远光调为近光
网络 直插；双列直插(Dual Inline Package)；沉
eg2: He dipped the brush into the paint.
他拿画笔蘸了蘸颜料。
Dip your hand in to see how hot the water is.
把手伸进去看看水有多热。
The fruit had been dipped in chocolate.
这水果蘸过巧克力酱。
The sun dipped below the horizon.
太阳落到地平线下了。
Sales for this quarter have dipped from 38.7 million to 33 million.
本季度销售额从 3 870 万下降到 3 300 万。
The road dipped suddenly as we approached the town.
我们向镇里驶近时道路陡然下斜。
The plane dipped its wings.
机翼向下倾斜。
Let's go for a dip before breakfast.
我们早饭前去游一会儿泳吧。
a sharp dip in profits
利润急剧下降
a dip in the road
路上的凹陷处
Puddles had formed in the dips.
低洼处形成了一个个水坑。
A brief dip into history serves to confirm this view.
随便翻阅一下历史就足以证实这种观点。
He gave a dip of his head.
他点了点头。

ex: vt. 分配；散布；分开；把…分类
eg2: In any case, you want to distribute the difference.
在这两种情况下，都需要对差额进行分配。
You can- not do this if people have no shoes;and to  shoes among millions of citizens is likely to require a centralised bureaucratic state.
你无法做到这些，如果老百姓没有鞋子，而且在数百万市民中分配鞋子很可能需要一个中央集权国家。
While companies have been establishing distributed organizations for some time, their motivations for doing so, as well as the way they distribute work, continue to evolve.
虽然公司已经暂时建立了分布的组织，但是它们这样做的动机，以及他们分配工作的方法都在继续演进。

eg2: After all expenses and , this is the final net figure.
扣去了所有的费用和股息，它就是最终的净值。
Switching to dividend yields or asset prices as a valuation measure does not eliminate the problem.
转向股息收益率或资产价格作为定价手段也无益于消除这一问题。

ex: vt. 泄露；暴露
eg2: The boy promised not to  the whereabouts of the hiding place.
那男孩许诺不泄露隐藏地的所在。
This kind of targeted attack – known as spear-phishing – has become so dangerous because of the amount of information we divulge on the internet.
这样带有目标性的攻击--叫做鱼叉式网路钓鱼--已经变得很危险，因为我们通常会在因特网上泄露大量的信息。
While an individual site may not divulge too much personal information, the aggregate of all this information may reveal more about them than people realize.
一个个人网站可能不会泄露太多的个人信息，但是当这些信息集合在一起，可能泄露的信息已经超出人们的认识。

wp.Contrast Enhance: 对比度增强;造影增强扫描

ex: vt. 提高；加强；增加
eg2: Once you do it, you will definitely enhance your sex life.
只要你做到这些,你的性生活质量就会提高。
Through focused desire and concentration, however, we can all  the abilities we were born with.
不过，通过聚焦欲望和高度专注，我们都可以提高这种与生俱来的能力。
For example, you cannot embed it in your own applications or  it with further functionality that you may need in your own projects.
例如，不能将它嵌入到您自己的应用程序中，也不能为之增加您的项目可能需要的更多功能。

ex: n. 考试；检查；查问
eg2: But I did tell you about the !
但我确实告诉过你有关考试的事。
Did he put all his students through the ?
他使他的学生都通过考试了吗?
His wedding clashed with my examination so I couldn't go.
他的婚礼与我的考试时间冲突，所以我去不了。

ex: adj. 假设的；爱猜想的

wp.Hypothetical protein: 假定蛋白;蛋白质;假设蛋白;假想蛋白

eg2: "We were speaking of a hypothetical case," I reminded him frostily.
“我们正在谈一个假设的案例。” 我冷淡地提醒他。
So you do look at hypothetical accidents and failure but they are judged to be very unlikely.
所以，你们观察这些假设的事故,和失败，但是他们是被认为不太可能发生的。
After all, we have no clue about the nature of these hypothetical aliens, why assume they're friendly?
毕竟，我们对这些假设的外星人的本性毫不了解，为什么要假设他们是友好的呢？
